https://prez.dev/description.@value: The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operatorâ€™s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

All borehole operations and activities are terminated. The operator has left the site with no intention of returning to the borehole. Note that this is similar to 'completed' status in the Australian Coal Logging Standards v3.1 (CoalLog). Also note that 'abandoned - energy' is similar to 'rehabilitated' as used by the mineral resources industry.

Decommissioning is a broad stage that involves the timely, safe, and environmentally responsible removal of, or otherwise satisfactorily dealing with, drilling-related property, equipment or infrastructure that is not in use, has not been maintained in working order such that it can be used, and has no demonstrable future use (i.e. has no associated permissioning documents allowing for and outlining plans for future use). The term is predominantly used in the energy industry.

Drilling of the borehole is complete and no further activity (other than decommissioning/rehabilitation) is planned. Note that in the Australian Coal Logging Standards v3.1 (CoalLog), 'completed' status is closer in meaning to 'abandoned' in this vocabulary).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A borehole that is no longer operating and for which activities are completed, i.e. the borehole is fully decommissioned/rehabilitated.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole that is no longer operating and for which activities are completed, i.e. the borehole is fully decommissioned/rehabilitated.
In the mineral industry, the borehole site has been fully rehabilitated. Note that this status is similar to the PPDM definitions of 'abandoned' as used by the energy industry.
A borehole that is not rehabilitated. Typically this includes boreholes drilled prior to mandatory rehabilitation legislation coming into effect.
